website_summaries.verdict: Stands out among its competitors for features, convenience, and affordability – hands down the best deal on the market.
pros: A popular model at a value price
It's collapsible, available in various sizes, and comes with a bottom tray and divider
cons: The larger sizes are heavy and somewhat awkward to fold, but this is a minor concern considering the value

customer_reviews.title: Our puppy is dead
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 week old German Shepard puppy was able to open the top latch and tried to get out of the top of this kennel. He was wedged in the cage so tightly that when he was found he was dead. We were gone less than 30 minutes. Our children are devastated. We are devestated. This kennel was suppose to be a safe place for our puppy. I hope no other family has to experience a tragedy like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about these crates because of the reviews, but I'm so glad I bought them. I got two of the 48" and they're perfect for my Great Danes. They have plenty of room to stand and stretch. Sometimes they both lay in the same kennel and still seem comfortable. I've had no problems with the wire scratching them, and the kennels are very sturdy. I've included a picture of my 20 year old daughter and my 170 pound Great Dane sharing the kennel and there's still a little room left!!
customer_reviews.author: tracie taylor

customer_reviews.title: Ouch, sharp edges cut my finger.
customer_reviews.text: The black color was nice, but It cut my finger with one of its multiple sharp edges, when setting it up. The door was kind of loose, and the locks require some fidgeting to get them to close. Thinking it was maybe this one item, I went to Petco to check it out because they carry this brand in their shop, but it also had sharp edges. I ended up ordering the Petco deluxe 2 door create online, which cost about the same. Although is not black but a weird gray camo it did not slice my fingers and it is a lot more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Story

customer_reviews.title: Great crate!
customer_reviews.text: This crate is absolutely perfect for my 70 lb. English Bulldog. He has plenty of room to move around and get comfy. It's easy to setup and plenty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tilapia Waters

customer_reviews.title: GREAT COLOR DOESN'T MEAN A GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS! MY DOG JUST LOST PART OF HER NOSE BECAUSE OF THE METAL CLAMPS ON IT! ALSO, THE HANDLE DOES NOT STAY ON, AND REGARDLESS MY LITTLE 12 POUND DOG MANAGED TO EAT THE HANDLE (ITS PLASTIC) AND LUCKILY DID NOT CHOKE TO DEATH ON THE PIECES OF PLASTIC. GREAT COLOR DOESN'T MEAN A GREAT PRODUCT. THIS IS NOT SAFE FOR DOGS! SO SORRY I BOUGHT IT MY DOG WILL FOREVER HAVE LOST THE TOP OF HER CUTE BLACK NOSE AND NOW IT IS RAW AND PINK. REMOVE THIS PRODUCT SO DANGEROUS!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect highly.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect highly..... recommend. Our Rottweiler loves his crate. I threw a couple of treats and his bed and he went for it and laid down and now I keep the door open so he could come in and out freely. This is his safe space and no way do I ever use it as punishment. Soon as he saw the crate he was immediately housebroken because he knew he would have to sleep in there overnight with the gate closed, but we never got to that point. This is a very sturdy crate and is ideal for 150 pound Rottweiler. He is currently 65 pounds at 6 months so he still growing.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Collodel

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Sharp edges on wire ends at cage door opening side.
customer_reviews.text: Put my little dog in the cage for the first time for about 10 minutes. When I came back the top tip of his nose was bleeding. Upon examination of the cage, I noticed very sharp edges on the ends of the wires at the door opening. I filed them smooth. This is NOT acceptable! I Should return it but I need the cage now! Besides it would be too much of a hassle. Come to think about it, I got a puncture on my arm as I was assembling it. Now I know what happened. You people need better quality control! Shame on you people! On second thought, I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Sibbern

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY UNSAFE. DO NOT BUY THIS FOR YOUR DOG!
customer_reviews.text: This item is so incredibly and ridiculously unsafe. I received it today and there are SHARP EDGES everywhere on the product. I cut myself just setting it up, nevermind what might happen to my dog if she were to poke her little paws or nose out of it. Even the part at the bottom of the door where the dog comes out has several sharp points that caught on the DOG BED when I placed it in there. This isn't just bad quality, this is a liability and an injury waiting to happen. This should not even be allowed to be sold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build with no tools needed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build with no tools needed. i purchased the 48'30'33 version for my German Shepard, and it is very large. I got her a size to big, but its more spare for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: We got the 30" with divider, double door. It's great for our 8.9 pound chihuahua/dachshund mix, Zoey. There is lots of space for her and is good for 2 small dogs in case we get a second. It's sturdy, seems well build, there were no missing pieces and was packaged well. It's the cheapest piece out of all of them and seems just as good. We are so impressed with this! Would for sure repurchase. The latch for the wide door doesn't seem to be that sturdy but there is actually another small latch thingy on the bottom that ensures the door stays closed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott.And.KikiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I tried to set it up this morning and the crate turned out to be useless. The door bottom lock didn’t work as shown ...
customer_reviews.text: Just order this crate last week after reading hundreds of 5-star review. I tried to set it up this morning and the crate turned out to be useless. The door bottom lock didn’t work as shown in the video. It also hurt my dog nose because he could play with it. It’s a waste of money! Such a shame for a big brandname
customer_reviews.author: glees shin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: This crate is a great value for the average dog! I use these crates for my own working dogs over night sleeps. Even if one gets destroyed, they are afforable enough to replace. I’d recommend, squeezing ALL the clips closed on crate. Even the most docile dog could get this crate to collapse or open with little to no effort.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richards

customer_reviews.title: Latch Doesn't Stay Closed, Rolls Too Easily
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up, that was nice. But there are other issues that cannot be dismissed. Side door latch does not close tightly, my dog can use her paw to push it up to the right and open the door. Right now it is held shut by two metal carabiners that she cannot chew off. The wheels, which seemed like a good idea, make the crate unstable on hardwood floors unless it is completely backed up against a wall. Returning this crate tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: lmw

customer_reviews.title: WARNING
customer_reviews.text: This particular product should come with a WARNING!! It was unsuitable for my 9 week old German Shepherd puppy. She caught her upper jaw with canine teeth in wired crate....It was HORRIBLE!!! Thankfully she is okay but no puppy nor pet parent should have to experience this. Luckily I removed her from this crate IMMEDIATLY and ordered a Petmate Vari Kennel. I just feel blessed that I was there when this happened. BE CAREFUL if you are considering ordering this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, good quality and easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised by the great quality of this cage for the price! It even came with a divider and folds up very easily with a latch to keep it all closed up and tidy. Putting it up was no problem at all...took 2 minutes out of the box. Side door means I can put it flush against my wall so it doesnt stick out in the room so far. Perfect spot for my Doberman pup to chill out and give me a break! We bought the 36" one, we will buy the larger one when we need it. That side door is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: kim s

customer_reviews.title: Everything great but leading entry edge on bottom
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and the sturdiness of this crate. Only one problem....at the bottom on the inside of the crate where the bottom of the door hits, the wire has been cut and the edges left are extremely sharp. I have to put a towel over that part of the entry to ensure that my dog who stretches out does not accidentally cut his toes. He sometimes seems to push his feet up against the metal. Nothing has happened so far, but I am not taking any chances as I inadvertently passed my fingers across that section while straightening up his bedding (towels). Just an FYI....probably should've contacted MidWest with the issue but I needed the crate!!!
customer_reviews.author: APTexan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy locks and wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Ineffective. My 30lb Boxer puppy shook the door and the top lock slid open. She then was able to push open the top and squeeze her way out, but her whole leg got caught in the top of the door. Thank GOD I have a puppy cam and was able to have someone go rescue her right away. Otherwise she very likely would have broken her leg. I do not recommend this crate since the locks do not work and your dog can escape or get hurt.
customer_reviews.author: MeReader

customer_reviews.title: Pretty in Pink
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my mother and her little morkiepoo. The dog crate is very easy to collapse and open back up. Very important feature for my mother as she is getting older and doesn’t feel like messing with stuff or assembling things. This crate comes fully assemble, in the collapsed position. Just need to unpack from box, pull out the sides, top, and door. Then the final step is attaching the handle. Super easy. A big plus is the pink color. Obviously, the morkiepoo needs everything in pink!
customer_reviews.author: Brad G.

customer_reviews.title: Who let my dog out? This, this, this, this, this
customer_reviews.text: I bought the very large version which was more reinforced but too big for my dog. So I got the large size (for up to 40ish pounds), which unfortunately is *not* well-reinforced. My dog busted out and decided to redecorate my window dressings - adios, curtains. She's new, I'm learning. It's fine. But a word to other buyers: carabiners are your friend. I attached them all around the front of the crate and so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Hazardous - rough ends
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in time, looked good, put together easy. SO many good reviews but there were some that mentioned rough ends. I decided to see for myself. They were right. The ends were rough enough to cut me during assembly. The cut was painful for a good 5 days. I returned it. No need to risk me or my big guy cutting ourselves. Good news is Amazon makes returns easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ms P

customer_reviews.title: Crate good but the divider doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the crate but because of the 2 doors, I couldn't get the divider to reach across. I think the divider is made for 1 door crates. The extra door makes the crate slightly wider. I ended up not needing the divider because the puppy didn't go potty in his crate even with the extra space and he enjoyed the extra room. I'm glad I got the 2 doors version. I now use a different door for him so he doesn't have to step in his pee pad as he exits his crate anymore but as a puppy that was a good idea in case he had to go right away.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product!! Great size, very durable. Love that it came with 2 doors (front & side) . This helps when you are deciding where you are going to put it in your home. Ordered mine with a divider so my puppy can grow into it. I love that this is an option. The thought of having to buy multiple crates because large puppies grow SO FAST would be terrible. I would highly recommend. VERY easy to assemble (there really isn't much assembly - it's just a matter of unfolding the crate) and shipping was VERY quick.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't feel right to my hands. I think it's that there is too much play in it? And I was really dissatisfied with the door. Our dog was able to bounce it unlocked and then open it. We've been using clips to keep the door closed, but it's hard to put them on and off because the wires don't align. I'm happier with another crate we bought off Amazon, but I don't think I'm allowed to mention a rival brand in a review. Let's just say that I love the precision of the door system.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We put this out on our covered back deck for the silver lab (14 months) and chocolate lab (7 months) pups. This is large enough for the two of them to fit into at the same time. One on top of the other, acting like crazy kids. It is strong enough to withstand them bouncing around, being pinned in the corner, hitting the roof of the crate and spilling out onto the deck at a full run. No dents, unhinged walls or overturned crate. We are impressed. When they do take a rest, they love to lay in the morning sun inside their new crate, even though they have another bed right next to the crate.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: Fits our big baby perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I adopted a husky malamute mix that needs a lot of work. We were told by his previous family he was kennel trained but didnt give us any of his things when we adopted him and crates at the stores were way too much. This one is great and does the job. Definitely fits our big baby. We haven’t tried leaving him in it for me to speak to standing up to him but it feels like any other crate I have had in the past. I especially like the dual door option.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey J.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile crate, awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This crate is very versatile. There are 2 doors so it allows the crate to conform to the needs of your room. The divider is very good as you can make the space bigger as your dog grows. If you use the side door though, the smallest you can make the crate with the divider is about half of the full crate. Pee cleanup is easy with the hard plastic base and setup was a breeze. Overall this is wonderful and you can get decorative covers to match your room!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Received a previously opened item
customer_reviews.text: This item was not advertised as having been opened and removed from the box by another buyer. It was pretty clear when I received it because the box was beat up and taped over where the box had been previously opened. Also, whoever opened it the first time did not put it back into the box properly, but I was able to navigate through that. The product is fine and I’m happy with the quality, just not happy with having received something that someone else had already opened and returned. That should’ve clearly been represented in the product details. Also, it is customary to sell opened items at a lower price for the very reasons that I stated above.
customer_reviews.author: rhall37735

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I got this crate today, and am sending it back tomorrow. Two of the back clips were closed so there was no way to hook it, (so one side of the back could be pushed through), the door only has one latch so the bottom of the door doesnt close tight. A dog could get hurt trying to get through the space, and the top wouldnt lock on the front. Terrible quality. I spent more money and am exchanging for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbie

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog. The crate was well packaged with instructions however you really don't need them it's pretty simple. This is my 2nd purchase of this crate, the first was for my daughter's pup. The two doors are convenient I doubt I'll use the divider since I have the smaller crate. The only thing negative is the clip-on handle, it clips on and off, it's not very sturdy, there really isn't a center point for it to clip to so it's inefficient, and comes off easy. When I move it I carry it by the crate sides. In spite of the handle, this cage is a very good value and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Small-Medium puppy
customer_reviews.text: Athena is a rescue, apx 10 months & 51 lbs. She does well so far. First kennel was too small, this is too big. Panel makes it just right size. Athena uses this to sleep at night. She likes to pull bed out (if not closed), but has had no accidents in kennel. We don't fold during day, it stays up. Athena has an outdoor dog-run for daytime (weather has been great since rescue). Working on Athena living in our home.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Little Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This isn't terribly sturdy, but it suits my purposes just fine. I have a meek and mild mannered dog who won't get rough or try to fight his way out, so the frailness is OK. I did reinforce the corners and top because I am also using it as a grooming table for my dogs and it needed the additional stability. So, yeah, if you have a mild mannered calm dog who already loves being crated, this is a good crate. It is not a good training crate or to be used with a dog that dislikes or fights being crated.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brothers

customer_reviews.title: Fits 110lb Akita!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy! Bought this for an 110lb American Akita. I was worried it wouldn’t fit him adequately and it ended up being an eerily perfect fit for him. The bottom tray’s ability to be locked in place is fantastic—keeps the dog from shifting around and moving the tray from the crate. I had to use a little WD40 on the hinges of the metal door, which helped immensely with squeaking and initial tension, but there are no longer any issues. It’s a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie G.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Front door panel is bowed inside and it does not snap with side panels. Also, came in with missing wheels I only have two in cage and they just come right off and made of weak plastic. Cage is Made out of weak material and it’s very flimsy. If you got little Pom Pom dogs it will be okay but if you got Pit bulls or Rotties it’s not the cage you want. I was very excited when I ordered it now I have the panels zip tied so it don’t come loose. Returning is too much hassle so ima just have to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Mohsin

customer_reviews.title: can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: We have a 6 month old 70 pound mastiff puppy who is quickly outgrowing all her crates. We read all the reviews before purchasing, so once we received it & set it up we checked every inch of the crate for sharp spots. We didn't have any on ours, the only thing we dislike about the crate is how easily the bottom tray slides right out, our old crate had a locking system that held it in place, we're going to have to rig something up to keep the puppy from sliding the tray out.
customer_reviews.author: L Pow

customer_reviews.title: Great crate MADE IN THE USA at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and rugged. I ordered the XL for our lab puppy that will probably get to around 70-75 lbs so she'd have a bit more room than necessary... I did the same with our last dog's dog bed and am glad I did because while it seemed enormous when she was a puppy she filled it out by the time she was full grown. The movable interior grate to gradually expand the area as the puppy grows is necessary and having 2 opening doors so you can position the crate in various ways against a wall depending on the space you have is a great benefit as well. Very well made for the economical price.
customer_reviews.author: Deepsea21

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: We already had a 36" crate so I bought another 36" crate so my two growing puppies could each have their own. When this arrived and we put it together, it was soooo much easier than the existing crate we had. As our puppies continue to grow, we decided to get rid of the older crate and get a new, larger one. So, I bought the 42" and, right now, both puppies fit inside. They're mixed breed but they both weigh 30lbs and 27lbs if that helps. We'll soon probably need to put up the 36" again so they can have their own spaces once again. This crate is super easy to put up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: goldngemgirl

customer_reviews.title: A must
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Ordered this for potty training a Feral cat with A polyp on her nose after 3 days of being in crate. It taught her to use the litter box Each day I would let her out for awhile as a reward. Now she knows when its time to go, Where to go. These crates are a blessing, strong , very durable. Use to have on for a dog long rime ago (regretted giving the crate away) Also great in emergencys Situations or having work done in home when need to put your pet safely away for awhile So they are not in the way of harm. 5*’s given to thos product
customer_reviews.author: JAMES MULVEY

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Watch out for sharp ends on most all the spindles on this thing. The handle doesn't fit in the middle of the crate and so slides, tipping the crate to the side. Divider is useless even for two tiny animals. The openings between the bars would not hold a mouse secured. The small crate wouldn't comfortably fit my Morkie. Barely fit my cat. No room to move around. Be careful when interpreting the size. It's not 18 inches wide. It's 18 inches long, and 12 inches wide. That's the length of a ruler wide. This crate truly delivers what you paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Earrings

customer_reviews.title: A feature laden bargain.  A similar product in the stores cost three times as much
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy a $180 crate from the local pet store. Went on Amazon and saw this. 35,000 reviews? I’ll take a shot. It is perfect. Sets up in like 15 seconds. A removable tray (thank goodness I’m not had to use it). This is a must for potty training. The divider makes it easy to give our puppy enough space to turn around but not so much space that he will pee in one corner and live in the other. Of course as the puppy gets bigger, the divider is movable and removable. simply stated, it is much better, more feature laden and less expensive than anything I have seen in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second crate of this brand. The first I’ve used for about 5 years, and am replacing with a size smaller - the original was far larger than needed, and I decided the smaller would fit the space better, and still be plenty of space for my dog. One of the hinges at the bottom is bent, so that side is a bit weird, and two of the bars are already bent. I noticed these issues before even assembling. I have no desire to deal with the hassle of returning, so I fixed the bent hinge with some pliers. Still, quality could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn A. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This crate is an excellent buy at less than $20. The plastic crates are typically more expensive. Pros: -looks more attractive than a plastic crate -better durability than a plastic crate - folds down for storage when not in use - you can take out the tray to clean -the tray seems to be made out of a durable plastic Cons: -if you have a male dog or cat that likes to pee, they can easily do this out the sides -if you have a dog that likes to chew or scratch, the plastic tray may not hold up or easily replaced
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Broken sharp bar
customer_reviews.text: When I first put my puppy into this crate early in the morning he yelped in pain. I leaped out of bed and couldn’t find anything wrong with him. Months later I noticed one of the bars was broken off and very jagged and sharp, I think he licked the end. I never noticed this until today as that side is against the wall. I’m sure it came this way but I can’t return as the return window is up. Make sure you inspect the complete crate before you use it, I put some tape over the end, not sure how to fix the defected bar so it doesn’t happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Graham

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for Tea cup sized dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Ok this crate is PERFECT! i have a 4 lb dog and this is really the perfect size for him. Delivered quicker than expected and SUPER easy to assemble! I also ordered a bed with the same size (18 inch) from the same company. We had a waaaay bigger crate for him and he rarely used it for about a year. I'm so glad I finally found the perfect sized crate. Should def be in the top 3 for 'TOY" breed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for several reasons. 1. Brand name usually means good quality 2. description says it is easy to assemble and fold down, 3. Ease of transport. When I got the product it took me over 30 minutes to get it to get assembled. It was so frustrating I almost cried. THEN, the main reason I bought it was because it said, it folds down QUICKLY and EASILY to transport anywhere. I was planning a car trip and needed it to fold down. IT DIDN"T. My 48 year old son couldn't even get it to fold down. I would never recommend this to anyone, and I am so disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: cubagal

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use this for potty training, but I'm sure it would have worked nicely for that purpose. It is my first baby's little den for when I am away, only I haven't been away for about a month now because of the current coronavirus situation. It is big enough for my 5 lb. pomchi to turn around in, and she has room to wiggle around. I had previously gotten a larger size (pink one) and that one took up too much space. This one is just the right size. It was exactly as expected, and I didn't end up using the divider, since she is fully grown.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Quality crate in fashion color
customer_reviews.text: MidWest is the gold standard in manufacturing quality crates and this crate is no exception. The price point through Amazon for this crate is a steal. I've been buying MidWest for over 10 years and never once came away disappointed. The wire is sturdy and their paint process holds up, unlike other brands I've purchased. The oldest MidWest crate I have in use I bought is almost 11 years old that has received daily use for a German Shepherd dog and it looks as good as the day I bought it. I've never had to purchase a replacement tray for any of the crates, as they hold up very well over the years. You cannot go wrong with this crate.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Carson

customer_reviews.title: Great for confining my dog while I am not home
customer_reviews.text: My adult miniature poodle rescue dog is housebroken, but she is very unreliable when left home alone even if I have just taken her out and I am away for only a few hours. There is plenty of room for her to stand and move around and she is able to see out, so it works well. She has not been able to open it. I thought it was somewhat difficult to unfold because it kept getting caught on other parts, and probably won't be any easier to fold down for transport although the concept is excellent. Maybe the difficulty I had is due to my lack of skill. It works well for her.
customer_reviews.author: Wary

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's Safe House
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very afraid of loud noises. She cowers and shakes and has hidden in closets, under beds, etc. I bought this for her to create a 'safe room'. I bought the cover for it and it fit well. Then I covered the crate with several layers of blankets to deaden sounds. I put a nice cushion and pillow in the crate. I wasn't sure she'd use it....but we got over the 'fear' of something new. She now goes into the 'safe house' whenever she is afraid or there are loud noises. This is a great help for a dog terrified of loud noises.
customer_reviews.author: Bokworm

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: No sharp ends, well made and coated. Had one for years from Midwest before this one, but gave it away. These are great if you need something of this size. Dogs love it. Especially with a cover during a thunderstorm. I zip tie the top corners so no chance of it unfolding with them inside (neurotic, I am). You can't beat this price for the quality. ps I haven't had a problem, but there was a beagle puppy who caught her pad between the door and the frame (one in a million) on the three door model years ago. I don't see that happening with the one I just received.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed latch
customer_reviews.text: This crate is great for the price except for one thing...the latch. My 9 lb schnauzer mix managed to get it open, get out, and urinate on the couch while I was out. If the pin were bent at the end, it would be secure. I didn't foresee it being an issue when I ordered it, but as it turns out I should have kept looking for something with a better latch.
customer_reviews.author: Rhandi Giles

customer_reviews.title: Great Crate
customer_reviews.text: The crate was smaller than I expected (but I wasn't paying attention to size specifics) but still is perfect for our puppy. It was already together in box and just needed to be unfolded , coupe of snaps and it was ready to use. Love the removeable liner for easier puppy cleanups and it is convenient having the second door. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Fallen

customer_reviews.title: Divider great for smaller dog
customer_reviews.text: When we first put this together and let her sleep in it, I did not put in the divider. She peed in the back of the cage. I read the instructions again and they recommend using the divider to size the dogs area just enough for their sleeping area. So we made the area smaller. She goes into the cage easily and has enough room to curl up in either side. Since using the divider she has NOT soiled the cage. Instead she whines or barks to be taken out. So good cage but use the divider to adjust usable area for your size dog.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Cool Travel

customer_reviews.title: Weak construction and poor insert
customer_reviews.text: For a steel wire crate I expect far more. Over the years I've housed a 70+ lb GSD, a 55 lb Mal, and a 60 lb Husky in Lucky Dog brand crates. However I made a mistake and wanted to try this one out due to the reviews. My 62 lb Staffy had no problems bending the frame of this crate and shredding the insert in less than the 30 minutes I was at the store. If you have a dog with even an average amount of strength look elsewhere because this one isn't worth the money. It was real easy to fold and assemble though so I guess there's that. The construction on this one is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: crate appears flimsy, at best. our trainer noted the lack of quality and told her to reinforce the door but i am returning the item instead. why should i buy things to fix an item that is supposed to be ready for use without any problems?
customer_reviews.author: Armbella

customer_reviews.title: I know why the caged dog howls
customer_reviews.text: We have a Yorkie, and she gets pretty worked up pretty often. While we learn to calm her when we have visitors, we sometimes put her in her "home". If we're cleaning or otherwise engaged and she keeps getting in our way, we can keep her in it and know that she's safely contained, and the easy latch means that even the younger grandkids can let her out. It's also a convenient place to put her basket of toys and personal belongings.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Gal

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built
customer_reviews.text: Just got the cage today and tried to assemble it. First, the entire item is covered in a black film that gets all over your hands. No matter how much I tried to clean it off, the residue was still there. Second, portions of the cage were completely bent out of shape. It wouldn't sit flat on the floor because the base was bent. One of the doors wouldn't latch because the lock and hook did not line up correctly. Once assembled, the cage was lopsided due to the bent panels. There was no way to bend them into their correct shape. Sending this one back.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value, easy to assemble and break down, easy to store. Bought this size for my goldendoodle puppy that was 8 lbs at 8 weeks and around 40 lbs at 5 months. I used the divider at first. This size could fit him for his entire life, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Anne MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Came all bent up.
customer_reviews.text: One whole side is smashed in and one of the little tabs that holds it together popped out of the box, unconnected. I had to smash it back on with pliers. We had a difficult time "unfolding" this, because all the edge wires caught on each other. That may partly be due to the smashed-in side. We had to rip open the box to even get it out. It is too heavy to send back, (and the box is ruined) and I certainly won't be able to fold and unfold this for travel because it is bent. But it does work, as long as we don't ever want to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Best crate for very small puppies and dogs
customer_reviews.text: This crate was exactly what I was looking for! I have a very small yorkie mix puppy and it has been a nightmare crate/housebreaking her because of her size! Every kennel just has too much space. This crate is perfect for very small dogs!! Most importantly it comes with a wire divider to split the already small crate in half! Now my puppy has enough room to take a nap and chew on a toy, but not find a spot to poop. This crate has been a life saver for potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love the crates by MidWest. Have several. This particular one was slighly different in thst the door latch was soldered on a bit off so the latch doesn't operate as smoothly as the others. Also, more irritating to me is that the tray is not smooth. It has more txture to it than the others and when I clean it with paper towels, the dirt sticks and is harder to clean. Whereas the other trays are smooth and easy to wipe off. But I would still buy a MidWest crate for the size and the quality, so I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: IVJ

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 4+ years ago when we got our puppy, worked amazing for crate training and potty training... has a divider to help with that. You make it bigger as the puppy grows bigger. We found that she liked the crate MUCH better when we put a blanket or a sheet over it so it’s less of a cage and more of a cave. When you’re not training- still keep the door open so the pup can feel comfortable to go in there and hang out on their own. Great buy, wound up regifting to another couple who bought a puppy after we no longer needed it. I imagine we will buy this again if/when we get another puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Home Sweet Kennel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for our German Shepherd puppy to grow into. This kennel folds down for easy storage or travel, and provides a personal space for our pup! We have not used the divider as we did not find a need to. I strongly recommend kennel training for your dog/puppy and learn exactly the do's and don'ts to ensure you have a happy, healthy, safe, and well-trained pup! We have not experienced any issues with the slide "lock" mechanism as some other reviews have mentioned. Our experience has been positive with kennel training and our GSD (now 12 weeks old) loves her space.
customer_reviews.author: GiGiAZ

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Love this crate! Took minutes to set up and it’s great quality. Now this is based on a non destructive dog. The double doors are fantastic! I didn’t think I would like that feature but it left more options for me to put the crate in different places in my apartment. I really like this crate. The divider comes in handy too to transition puppies as they grow.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Love the crate, but disappointed with the divider.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great crate. Very well made and very sturdy. I don't know if the divider is a problem with every crate, or just a problem with mine. The divider is not wide enough to go from side to side. I attached one side, and then really had to bend the other side to get that side to attach. I can't attach the bottom loop because the crate won't bend near the bottom. Now one side of the crate, instead of being straight up and down, it is concave. If it weren't for this I would easily rate this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for first time with open kennel
customer_reviews.text: In the past, we have had a hard-sided plastic kennel. This provides much better air circulation and visibility for us to monitor how our puppy is doing. It took a few times folding it down and opening it up again to feel comfortable with the operation of it. But it is much more flexible for travel than our past kennels. It is a perfect size for our 14-pound puppy. He has enough room to get in and turn around and to lie down and sleep peacefully. It feels very durable and sturdy. We will get many years of good use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Simonson

customer_reviews.title: Nice crate. Good quality and design.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly. Price was lower than others I looked at and quality seems very good. It feels solid and looks very nice. The 18 inch is the perfect size for our yorkie. His bed fits perfectly so he adjusted to it very easily. He had digressed in his housebreaking skills so we wanted to crate him again to solve that problem. The design is cool in that it's fully assembled and folds flat for storage without having to take it apart and put it together again. It even comes with a removable partition to better fit puppies. Overall, we couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Conn

customer_reviews.title: Latches are NOT SECURE
customer_reviews.text: This crate is NOT SECURE. There is no locking mechanism to keep the door latches from sliding open. It’s a serious design flaw that can threaten the life of a dog. My dog was able to quickly and easily undo one of the latches and squeeze out of her pen. She’s a chewer, and she’s able to bend the metal wires out of place. Spend a little more money elsewhere, because it’s not worth jeopardizing the life of your animal over such a critical design flaw!!
customer_reviews.author: KatS

customer_reviews.title: 3 year review
customer_reviews.text: We love this crate. We bought it in April 2017 and it's now August 2020. This crate has held up very well, it's still in new kind of condition. We have never had any incidents with it nor has our cattle dog. We have had it since she was a puppy and the divider got us through the potty training stage smoothly. She loves her "room". She has space to stand and stretch out. I would definitely buy it again. My aunt got the largest one for her dog at the same time from the same seller, and she loves hers too.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo

customer_reviews.title: This crate saved my car
customer_reviews.text: My new puppy thought the car seats were for chewing. I tried various setups so my pup could learn to enjoy a car ride without constant whining and destroying my car. Using this wire crate in the car is working great!. She can see out and she can't damage my car. The whining has decreased dramatically. She sleeps in a larger wire crate at night, so she may associate this smaller one with the night time crate in the house. I just know it makes car rides so much better now. I did have to bend the latch a little to keep it closed and tight.
customer_reviews.author: Josey

customer_reviews.title: very handy and for the most part serves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: the kennel is so easy to assemble - but then every now and then a section pops apart - on the other hand, it's a small price for such an easy to assemble kennel. My dog loves it. The only downside is the locks are not very effective and eventually I am pretty certain my puppy is going to figure out how to open it - concerned that it will be at the time I'd prefer she was crated. Overall I recommend it. It's a good value - and some of the little pups keep growing out of them - so you can collapse it and get the next size.
customer_reviews.author: cie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my pups
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these since our pups will get to 60 lbs each at least. For now they are 35l bs each so we put both in one. They are sisters and love being together. The kennel is easy to open and close, easy clean out and easy assembly. We took the pups to a family get together, leaving one kennel at home assembled and taking the second one on our travels. Quick and easy portable bed for the pups. The kennel is a sturdy interlocking connection that I feel completely comfortable using with my pups inside. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Pabis

customer_reviews.title: Not a great crate
customer_reviews.text: I didn't mean to rhyme there but it is what it is. This crate seemed awesome, 2 doors, wheel for flooring - sure that's all grand but the latch is nothing. Like no 'lock' on it. A few paws at the door and my dog can get this open. So I'd say buy something else. I threw the box out, I should have looked at photos of the door but I've never seen a crate without some sort of locking feature for safety. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you zip tie...
customer_reviews.text: Great crate, except for dogs that try to escape because the pieces are just snapped into place. Bought black heavy-duty zip ties at Home Depot to make sure she didn't get any ideas and she stayed put. Worked great except she kicked the tray out of the bottom (thankfully didn't pee through to the carpet though). Just words of warning, no other crate of this style is any different (get an Impact Dog Crate if you want/need complete containment for safety or transport). Would buy this product again though.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Nice small folding dog or cat crate
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these & use them as small dens around the house for my cats as well as carriers for transporting to the vet, etc. A folded pad inside & a large towel draped over it makes it a cozy hide-away for a kitty nap & since the cats are familiar with them, using them to transport when needed is less stressful for them. They come completely assembled & are very easy to unfold.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Sue O.

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy, well build dog crate
customer_reviews.text: We have a Shepherd/Collie mix puppy that was outgrowing the crate that someone gave us. We decided to look online and saw that MidWest was a pretty popular brand. We decided to give it a shot and I can now see why it's so popular. It arrived on time and setting it up literally took 2 minutes. You lift out of the box, fasten a few things and voila, it's done. The crate size was perfect and the quality was great. We have had zero complaints. Our pup is going to be using this for a while to come.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This is a super fabulous crate!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great doggie crate, indestructible......very well made. The metal isn't appealing for chewing or biting...amazing! I returned it because I wanted a bigger one. I thought the 22" would be big enough; but thought I would get one with more room for him. It was NOT Amazon's fault. Amazon has always been very accurate and efficient in every transaction with me. The 22" was refunded very promptly and the 30" just arrived! It's very sturdy and easy to set up and take down!
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: This crate is fine but dogs just prefer the plastic crates
customer_reviews.text: This was a fine product. There were no defects so if this is the style you are looking for, then go for it. I thought I'd love that I could fold it up but we quickly realized we will never be folding our crates - in fact, we've given up the space under our dining table so our boys can have full time access to their crates. Our dogs were already socialized to the plastic style crates and they just seemed jumpy and unable to settle down in this one - I think it just didn't give them that cave-like privacy that they prefer.
customer_reviews.author: We3GermanShepherds

customer_reviews.title: Great crate and features!
customer_reviews.text: I have this for my labrador and love it. In the past, i did the molded plastic but it is better for your dog to see you. I bought this as a gift and my friend thought this size woudl work for their cocker spaniel but it was too big. I did replace with the 36 inch and it was perfect size. Th wire is strong all smooth edges and doube door is nice if the space is small. It is portable but I hav enot had to take it with me yet. Great crate, hgh quality and easy set up!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn K

customer_reviews.title: Good product, quick delivery, great price!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because it was a bit of a pain to put together. Some of the siding was bent a little when I opened the box....which made it difficult to put together. Overall quality seems good though. Our puppy loves to nap inside! I purchased a bigger size then what my puppy needs and used the divider for the first 2 or 3 weeks....now she has a roomy kennel that she loves napping in. I would recommend this but I'd suggest you may want a second set of hands when assembling.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara L

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to unfold the first time.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. Great for a large sized Labrador. Putting it together / unfolding it for the first time....Pain in the ass!!! The metal hooks were wrapped around the pieces that were supposed to fold out. I had to get a pair of pliers to unbend the hooks and then unfold the crate and bend them back. Some of the corner bends at the end were wrapped around the side pieces and I have no idea how that even happened. This was the most difficult crate I have ever “assembled” and I have three others. Otherwise, seems to be a good crate.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, has a divider.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this crate for my puppy for over 4 months now and I’m very satisfied it still looks brand new and my 5 lb dog loves it. He will only be 6 lbs full grown and will always need a small crate so I can’t speak to the quality of the larger crates, but I have no complaints at all with it. The divider is great, and the whole crate is pretty heavy duty and well made. He has started going back inside of it by himself after he pees every morning, which tells me he is comfy and happy using it. Much cheaper than pet smart.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned with some of the negative reviews so purchased the more expensive model vs. the Amazon basic. Arrived with no damage, not seeing any sharp points as others had mentioned. Used Tie straps to better secure the panels which I would certainly recommend. as expected the wire is a little thinner then my 20 year old model which is no longer made but will serve it purpose..
customer_reviews.author: fire

customer_reviews.title: Can't contain our 40 lb labradoodle
customer_reviews.text: She gets out of her crate every time I put her in it and leave the house. I've even reinforced with carabiners. Got a call from our alarm company yesterday indicating motion sensors going off in the house yet again. Sure enough, when I arrived, she was out of her crate. I couldn't even figure out HOW she got out. My husband (Mr Analyst) couldn't figure it out either. Either way, waste of our money. Sadly we'll have to spend MORE money by purchasing something else a whole lot sturdier and escape-proof.
customer_reviews.author: buleever

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Great for tiny puppies!
customer_reviews.text: Love having the insert to use for potty training. We got a yorkie and for a puppy of 3 lbs, we definitely needed something we could use that was very small. Love that this will grow with our puppy. We've had the crate for 4-5 months now and it's great! The insert can be adjusted... it attaches to the metal wires on the sides of the crate.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great for Training
customer_reviews.text: I love this crate. It's very convenient for training a puppy that will grow into a large dog. I didn't want to buy a small crate and then later have to purchase a bigger one. I mostly use the front door because while using the divider it blocks the side door but this is no issue at all. Very easy to assemble and transport if needed. But careful not to smash your fingers when handling the crate. My has grown to like her crate. She's 13weeks now and crate training is going well.
customer_reviews.author: hsjjacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Just right for my little girl puppy
customer_reviews.text: I had bought another small plastic crate but my puppy grew out of it in a couple mouths. This wire crate has an extra adjustable wire panel so while she was still small I could adjust the inside room which really helped with house training. now that she is getting bigger I have removed the panel and she has a comfortable "house" to stay in when she needs to. At the same time I also bought a small flat fitted bed for the bottom of the crate so she has a soft place to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Ed G

customer_reviews.title: Works but received slightly damaged
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give this a 5 star rating but am holding out for 2 reasons: First, it was received slightly damaged. It was on the side that doesn't have the door, so it is acceptable. Second, the latches should have an L design to keep them from slipping open easily. It was worth the $67 I paid but would't pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Memphis photo

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed & safe haven
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Australian blue healer. She was rescued at 9 months old & HATED to be crate trained. She ‘carried on’ & rocked the crate around. No issues with latch closure or safety of collapsing on her👌🏻 I have several dogs & have always used crates as ‘their personal safe space’ never for punishment or seclusion so I want my fur babies to feel safe & BE safe. Well constructed. Quick arrival, tray is much sturdier than my last crate that I payed way more cash for and was 6 “smaller. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I'm not one to post negative reviews, but I have to on this item for pet safety
customer_reviews.text: The side door does not close unless forced. 1 pic shows the door closed as far as it goes without force. Another shows when forced to latch, has a gap large enough for my hand. And a 3rd pic shows the nice cut on my arm AFTER it quit bleeding in attempting to deal with the door. I have bought Midwest crates in the past and was pleased. My pet will not be safe in this, as any attempt to escape ther gap could result in injury or death. I even tried several types of clips to hold it, but the force of the door gap made them spring off. RETURNING IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.author: chalkmtn

customer_reviews.title: Great for sleep and potty training
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to fold up abd sturdy when up. We started with 1 crate in the bedroom for night time and ended up ordering a second for the living room to use during the day. Using the crate during the day has helped so much with potty training and use keeping our sanity 🤪 the divider works great to grow with the pup. We also ordered the crate covers after using a sheet and they fit great. The price we paid for these crates were about half the price in store wanted for the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: James Baker

customer_reviews.title: Well built, good sized
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my 7lbs chihuahua! It’s easily broken down if you needed to travel with it. It has little rollers on the bottom which might be helpful if you have it under a table. Make sure to put a towel underneath it if using it on hardwood floors. My chihuahua was trying to pull her favorite blanket out of the crate and pulled the whole thing on her front paws (thanks to the roller wheels). One chihuahua squeak is enough, so please make sure to fasten the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: NYCflower

customer_reviews.title: Stood up to to seperation anxiety.
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted my my dog and bought her this crate to sleep in and ideally stay in when were away. We left her alone one day only to discover she has terrible seperation anxiety. We had a camera set up to watch her and saw her biting and doing whatever it took to get out. She was able to get out of the cage by pulling it in, but the cage as a whole still works for when she's in a calm stable state of mind. She's just not ready to be in it when we leave the house yet, we need to work up to that.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Crate!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my tiny Pomeranian. I simply unfolded it and it was ready. It is sturdy! The only complaint I have is the handle for carrying it does not clip on tight enough to safely carry the crate. When I picked it up the handle it came unhooked and I almost dropped the crate. So beware the handle.
customer_reviews.author: vickvee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dog kennel
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats this brand for metal dog crates. Easy to put together. Bottom plastic tray is easy to clean. Easy-slide latches. Great visibility for pet and owner. I use pillows and blankets inside for cushion and comfort. I don't use the kennel often as my dogs are potty trained and freely roam the house when I am gone. But these r good for short periods of time for puppies and dogs who are not potty trained since they are less likely to "go" where they sleep. Teaches them to hold it. Please do not use kennel time as a way out if being a great pet owner!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Whittier

customer_reviews.title: One design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: The product overall feels like good quality. Easy to Install, although the divider is a fight to fit. However, it loses 2 stars for a very unfortunate design error. The hooks on the small side door protrude out and look menacing. Your pet could easily get harmed. I am going to have to twist/hammer it into a safe angle. They did however get it spot on...on the other door hook. See picture. Go figure!?
customer_reviews.author: jamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great price, helped BIG TIME to get our yorkie puppy fully potty trained. We also got a sleeping mat for the exact size. We originally had a larger one at first but he started going in the corner of it, so got this one which was the exact size we needed. He never once went in it and it finally clicked that outside is where he should go potty. Doing really well now! It's very true when they say you have to get a crate just big enough for the dog to lay down and no larger.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Stock

customer_reviews.title: He loves his crate, naps in it and goes to it at bedtime.
customer_reviews.text: They said he would be 25 lbs tops. Well he's 5 months and 30 lbs. Wish I had gone larger. I had never crate trained a dog and anticipated having him out of it once he was house broken. Well that's not happening. He loves his crate, naps in it and goes to it at bedtime. He does not like sleeping in the utility room like my old dog did. Guess I gotta spring for a new larger crate, hopefully the last. I will def buy a MidWest iCrate when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Paper SlaveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good Review
customer_reviews.text: This crate is great for dogs that can’t break out easily. We have a German Shepherd that is strong enough to bend the metal on the doors to break out of the crate. We reinforced the doors with carabiners which seems to work enough to keep him from escaping. He also knows how to slide open the door latches as well so carabiners work for that too. If you have a dog bigger and stronger than a German Shepherd then you might want a crate that would hold a lion or a tiger because the metal on this one just isn’t tough enough for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly the easiest thing to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My dog probably doesn't like the purchase...but its been a lifesaver for me. The assembly of this crate is as easy as classic jumbo legos. We recently moved to a new house with new flooring and carpeting and I just couldn't trust if my dogs would be soiling the house while I'm at work. We haven't quite mastered the potty training but this crate is the first step to helping us achieve it. Assembling and dis-assembling takes less than 2 minutes. And despite its easiness - the crate retains its structure rather well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy crate on the cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a dog crate connoisseur or anything, but I thought this thing was crazy cheap and really well made. I bought the XL for my GoldenDoodle. It's oversized for her, but she's already housebroken so I just wanted it for bedtime (because I'm tired of getting punched in the face by her polar bear paws all night). She's not fighting to get out or anything, so I don't know how it'd hold up to a pup that isn't a fan of crates, but I think it's really sturdy and durably made. Very simple to assemble- just unfold. Ordering another for a new pup as soon as he outgrows his small kennel!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mayfield

product_meta.title: MidWest Homes for Pets Dog Crate | iCrate Single Door & Double Door Folding Metal Dog Crates | Fully Equipped
product_meta.description:
Size:42-Inch w/ Divider| Style:Double Door

The "all inclusive" Double Door iCrate, folding metal dog crate by MidWest Homes for Pets includes all of the features you will need to provide a convenient, safe & secure pet home for your best friend. This metal dog crate includes a free divider panel allowing you to adjust the size of the dog crate while your dog is still growing, a plastic leak-proof pan for easy clean-up in the event of an accident, a strong plastic carrying handle for easy portability & rubber "roller" feet on the bottom of the crate to protect your floors inside the home. MidWest iCrates also feature our patented side clips which reinforce the dog crate & reduce possible sharp points ensuring a safe experience for you and your pet. The iCrate Double Door metal dog crate configuration (with front & side door access) allows you to situate the dog crate to best fit your floor plan & folds down for convenient storage. The 42" metal iCrate (model 1542DDU) measures 42L x 28W x 30H inches & is suitable for "Large" dog breeds. **Please note the term “large dog” is subjective. For the best fit, we advise that you check the measurements of the actual dog crate against your dog’s adult weight & measurements. Your dog should be able to comfortably sit upright, lay down & easily turn-around inside the dog crate. When in doubt we suggest you purchase the larger crate option. We at MidWest Homes for Pets understand that your dog is a part of your family & that's why we ensure our dog crates are manufactured with the highest quality control standards creating a safe home for your pet that you can feel confident with. MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with our “MidWest Quality Guarantee” 1-Year Manufacturer's Warranty. If you have any questions about our dog crates our customer service department would be glad to help you. available 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM, Monday - Friday.

This crate is perfect if you have a Australian Shepherd, Golden Retriever, Labrador Retriever, or other large breed dog .
feature_bullets: ICrate the 'All Inclusive Dog Crate' Includes Free divider panel, durable dog tray, carrying handle, 4 'roller' feet to protect floors & midwest quality guarantee 1 year warranty
Your dog's home while you're away from home: Durable design creates a safe place for your pet while you're away & caters to your dog’s natural “den” instincts

Safe & Secure Home: Two heavy duty slide bolt latches firmly locks dog crate door in place keeping your dog safely inside their dog crate; ABS plastic pan Included provides a flat floor for the comfort of Your dog, plus it is WaterProof and will contain Spills if he has an accident
Easy assembly & portable design: Sets up in seconds w/ no tools required for assembly & folds flat for convenient storage or travel, Roller feet protect hardwoods, make repositioning easy

Large double door folding dog crate ideal for dogs w/ adult weight of 71 to 90 pounds, convenient divider panel allows crate to expand as your dog grows, mesh 1.5 x 7 7/8 inch; crate size 42 length x 28 width x 30 height inch
